page.title: 13Boscombe Church
page.content: Boscombe Church is dedicated to{St. {Andrew.}It is twenty metres long and five point four metres wide.It has a small belfry with bells dating back to {1675.}It is built of stone and flint with brick in some places.This is evidence of repair.Inside it has a three decker pulpit for the{ {preacher,reader}and {parish}clerk.The date is{1633. The church has box pews and at the back is a wind organ.The most distinguished rector of {Boscombe}was {Richard Hooker,}an author,who is often thought to have written his first four books in{Boscombe}between{1591}and{ {1594.}He died in {1600.} In {1707}John Kent made a will which set up a single storey house for the poor it is still standing today.In{ {1936}the church was{extensively {restored. By Simon Webb }
